page.title: 14Huxlow Comprehensive School
page.content: In 1961, a new secondary school was built in Finedon Road which took children from Irthlingborough, Finedon and other surrounding villages. This school became Huxlow Comprehensive School in 1976. Huxlow School is a county co-educational day school. The school is situated on the edge of the town, some 100 metres off the main A6 road. It has been extended many times. A Humanities block was added in 1977, new specialist rooms for dance and drama, music and art and fabrics were built during 1978. The last additions are a Sixth Form Suite and extended Science and Craft facilities in 1982. Since 1980, there has been a full comprehensive range of pupils throughout the main school and Advanced Level courses have been established in a range of subjects.
